presentation.fsa
Class ReflexiveEdge

java.lang.Object
  presentation.fsa.GraphElement
      presentation.fsa.Edge
          presentation.fsa.BezierEdge
              presentation.fsa.ReflexiveEdge
All Implemented Interfaces:
PresentationElement
public class ReflexiveEdge
extends BezierEdge

A symmetric self-loop manipulated by a single control point. TODO - refactor constructors (if super constructors are a pain, don't call them). - find a way to compute control points from midpoint, centre point, scalars and angles such that the midpoint set by the user remains fixed.

Author:
Helen Bretzke

Nested Class Summary
 class ReflexiveEdge.ReflexiveHandler
          Visual representation of the single control point at the midpoint of a reflexive edge.
 class ReflexiveEdge.ReflexiveLayout
          Same data as BezierLayout (control points and label offset vector) but different algorithms and handlers specific to rendering a self-loop.

Method Detail

insertAmong

public void insertAmong(java.util.Set<Edge> neighbours)
Searchs for enough space along circumference of node to place this edge. If not enough space, places this edge in the default position. TODO If not enough space, looks for a layout that doesn't clobber another reflexive edge.

Overrides:
insertAmong in class BezierEdge
Parameters:
neighbours - the set of edges between the source and target nodes
